19th and Early 20th Centuries

The modern era saw the rise of scientific inquiry and the eventual rejection of

flat Earth theories. In the late 19th century, scientists like William Whewell

and James Gurney proposed various experiments to demonstrate the Earth's

sphericity (Whewell's Experiment). However, flat Earth theories persisted in

some circles, with proponents arguing that scientific evidence was flawed or

manipulated.
